thread.title: Teacher Shames Mom for Sending Kid to School With Chocolate Cake
thread.title_full: Teacher Shames Mom for Sending Kid to School With Chocolate Cake

author: Ryan Adelson
title: Teacher Shames Mom for Sending Kid to School With Chocolate Cake
text:
Teacher Shames Mom for Sending Kid to School With Chocolate Cake Good Housekeeping 6 hrs ago Ryan Adelson Â© Facebook / Melinda Tankard Reist This Teacher Shamed a Mom for Sending Her Kid to School With Chocolate Cake When you pack your kid's lunch, you usually throw together a sandwich, drop in a piece of fruit and maybe add a little dessert if he actually got out of bed without you having to beg.
Not a sin, right? Well, according to one Australian teacher, this horrifying act of negligent parenting is worth sending home a warning - marked with a sad face on top in case there's any question as to how you should feel upon delivery.
Here's the deal: In Australia, a mom sent her 3-year-old to kindergarten with a slice of chocolate cake in the lunch bag. Unfortunately, a slice of this kind falls within the school's "Red Food Category," which encompasses unhealthy foods "that may contain excess energy (kilojoules), saturated fat, added sugar and/or salt." The list also includes sodas and deep-fried foods and is part of a full set of nutrition guidelines that all schools follow Down Under.
A friend of the officially-warned mother, Melinda Tankard Reist, who is also an author and advocate for women and girls, took to Facebook to back up her pal. Her post clearly hit a nerve, with more than 600 comments to date:
"My friend (mother of 8 healthy children, what follows relating to no. 7) received this today from her 3-year-old's kindy," Tankard Reist wrote (kindy = kindergarten). "I told her to put in two slices tomorrow and tell them to get lost."
"My child once got a note like that for graham crackers!" wrote one commenter, Nicole Renee.
Another commenter, Lena Giroux, voiced a different tactic for dealing with strict nutrition rules at school. "My kids' Elem school had the same kind of rules. I obeyed them. They ate what they wanted at home."
Either way, this makes us really, really want a slice of chocolate cake.
Click to expand Replay Video Sweet Baby Disapproves of Dad's Singing We're not sure if this baby is unhappy about his dad's singing or because he's reached his first birthday, but it's clear that this is one disgruntled baby! Whatever his reason might be, hopefully his next birthday will be cheerier with someone else singing the song for him! Viral Clips Daily 11 Babies Try To Talk To Siri It's really impressive how far technology has come along in the last few years. These babies are especially fond of talking with our new digital companion, Siri! While Siri might not always understand what they're saying, it doesn't mean that they don't have interesting conversations! Viral Clips Daily Baby tries to eat Cheeto through glass door ++CLIENTS PLEASE NOTE: THIS VIDEO HAS BEEN LOOPED++ A cute video has emerged from the US of a baby trying to eat a Cheeto through a glass door. The video, filmed in San Diego, California last year, shows the young boy desperately trying to get the snack into his mouth, but he can't because there's glass in the way.
